  • Paper 3, Section II, G

    #Algebraic Geometry
    2009

    Let VVV be a smooth projective curve, and let DDD be an effective divisor on VVV. Explain how DDD defines a morphism ϕD\phi_{D}ϕD​ from VVV to some projective space. State the necessary and sufficient conditions for ϕD\phi_{D}ϕD​ to be finite. State the necessary and sufficient conditions for ϕD\phi_{D}ϕD​ to be an isomorphism onto its image.

    Let VVV have genus 2 , and let KKK be an effective canonical divisor. Show that the morphism ϕK\phi_{K}ϕK​ is a morphism of degree 2 from VVV to P1\mathbb{P}^{1}P1.

    By considering the divisor K+P1+P2K+P_{1}+P_{2}K+P1​+P2​ for points PiP_{i}Pi​ with P1+P2≁KP_{1}+P_{2} \nsim KP1​+P2​≁K, show that there exists a birational morphism from VVV to a singular plane quartic.

    [You may assume the Riemann-Roch Theorem.]

    Let H1,H2∈k[X0,X1,X2]H_{1}, H_{2} \in k\left[X_{0}, X_{1}, X_{2}\right]H1​,H2​∈k[X0​,X1​,X2​] be nonzero linear forms.
